text:
You found the truth. And it broke you.

The missing aren't missing. They're harvested.

The town isn't a hunting ground. It's a farm.

The government knows. The bureau knows. They aren't trying to stop it; they're trying to optimize the yield.

You gather your evidence. You prepare your report. You address it to the press, the President, God himself.

But as you lick the envelope, you taste the glue.

It tastes like copper.

Like blood.

And you realize: You aren't the whistleblower.

You're just another part of the supply chain.
